author: apetitjean
body:
Applies to all versions of PowerShell (Windows and Core)

When searching all cmdlets that own the parameter ComputerName, Get-Command and Get-Help does not provide the same cmdlets.

Steps to reproduce
------------------

```powershell
$gcm = gcm -ParameterName computername | select -expand Name

$help = help * -Parameter computername | select -expand name

compare-object -ReferenceObject $gcm -DifferenceObject $help -IncludeEqual


InputObject          SideIndicator
-----------          -------------
Connect-PSSession    ==           
Enter-PSSession      ==           
Get-PSSession        ==           
Invoke-Command       ==           
New-PSSession        ==           
Receive-Job          ==           
Receive-PSSession    ==           
Remove-PSSession     ==           
Rename-Computer      ==           
Restart-Computer     ==           
Stop-Computer        ==           
Get-WinEvent         =>           
Invoke-WSManAction   =>           
Remove-WSManInstance =>           
Get-WSManInstance    =>           
New-WSManInstance    =>           
Test-WSMan           =>           
Disconnect-WSMan     =>           
Connect-WSMan        =>           
Set-WSManInstance    =>           
Send-MailMessage     <=           


```

Expected behavior
-----------------

Returned cmdlets should be the same.

Actual behavior
---------------

There are many differences between Get-Command and Get-Help. The result should be consistent.

Environment data
----------------

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```powershell

Name                           Value                                                                                                                                
----                           -----                                                                                                                                
PSVersion                      6.0.1                                                                                                                                
PSEdition                      Core                                                                                                                                 
GitCommitId                    v6.0.1                                                                                                                               
OS                             Microsoft Windows 10.0.14393                                                                                                         
Platform                       Win32NT                                                                                                                              
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}                                                                                                              
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3                                                                                                                                  
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1                                                                                                                              
WSManStackVersion              3.0                                                                                                                                  



```

comments.author: mklement0
comments.body:
The `Send-MailMessage` discrepancy is explained in https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/issues/6175#issuecomment-366521886, and a change has been suggested in #6183.

The other differences appear to stem from `Get-Help` - unexpectedly - not finding cmdlets from modules that are discoverable via `$env:PSModulePath`, but _which happen not to be imported into the current session_.

The `=>`-marked cmdlets above come from two modules that aren't loaded by default; if you import them explicitly and re-run your command, they will turn to `==` entries (the only remaining difference should be the previously mentioned `Send-MailMessage`):

```powershell
# Run this, then try your command again.
Import-Module Microsoft.PowerShell.Diagnostics, Microsoft.WSMan.Management
```

If you agree with this assessment, please update the title and original post accordingly.

title: Get-Command * -Parameter Computername doesn't return same result as Get-Help * -Parameter Computername
